p: Antithrombotic potential was also confirmed in a study based on dietary administration of oil-rich fish (500 g/week for 4 weeks), which resulted in reduced platelet-monocyte aggregation in the study group compared to the control [ 81]. Additionally, when administered concomitantly with policosanol (10 mg/d)—a mixture of higher aliphatic primary alcohols purified from sugar-cane wax—oil-rich fish were shown to be a safe and effective as a lipid-lowering agent [ 82, 83, 84].
